Plot a Confusion Matrix Heatmap

Source: R/plot_conf_matrix.R
plot_conf_matrix.Rd

This function takes a confusion matrix object (e.g., from caret::confusionMatrix) or a similar structure containing a table of predictions versus actuals, and generates a visually appealing heatmap using ggplot2. It displays counts in each cell and uses percentages for fill intensity.

Usage

plot_conf_matrix(conf_mat)

Arguments

conf_mat

A list-like object. This object is expected to have an element named "table". conf_mat$table should be a table object or a matrix (convertible to a tibble) where as_tibble(conf_mat$table) results in columns for predicted values, actual values, and a column of counts (typically named 'n' if conf_mat$table is a table object). The function assumes the classes are "nondiabetic" and "diabetic".

Value

A ggplot object representing the confusion matrix heatmap.
